name: Delvin Mallory

aspects.trouble: Sentimental About the Guild's Glory Days

stunts: Black Market Connections: +2 to Contacts when dealing with fences, smugglers, or criminal networks
Appraiser's Eye: +2 to Notice when evaluating stolen goods or detecting forgeries
Old Friends Everywhere: Once per session, call in a favor from an underworld contact in any major city
notes: Delvin Mallory is a veteran member of the Thieves Guild who serves as its primary fence and maintains connections throughout Skyrim's underworld. He's older, wiser, and more laid-back than most guild members. Delvin remembers the guild's glory days and yearns to see it restored. He's a mentor figure who offers advice, jobs, and connections. His extensive network of contacts makes him invaluable for moving stolen goods and establishing guild presence in cities.
combat_tactics: Delvin avoids combat at all costs, relying on his contacts and silver tongue to talk his way out of trouble. If cornered, he'll use distractions and environmental tricks to escape.
social_interaction: Delvin is friendly, talkative, and approachable. He speaks with the confidence of someone who's seen it all and survived. He's generous with advice and stories about the guild's past. He treats younger thieves like protégés and has a warm, almost fatherly demeanor despite his criminal profession.

relationships.Brynjolf: Close friend and fellow old-timer in the guild
relationships.Mercer Frey: Respects as Guild Master, though sometimes questions his coldness
relationships.Vex: Close working relationship on city influence jobs
relationships.Karliah: Remembers her as Gallus's partner, believes traitor story
relationships.Gallus: Former friend and guild member, mourns his death

personality_notes.speaking_style: Warm, conversational, uses terms of endearment like 'lad' or 'lass', tells stories
motivations: Restore guild to its former glory
See guild prosper again before he retires
quirks: Always knows someone who knows someone
personality_notes.character_growth: Delvin finds renewed purpose as the guild is restored, seeing his networks and mentorship pay off

story_hooks: Provides city influence jobs alongside Vex
Offers fence services for stolen goods
Can establish contacts in any major city
Provides advice on criminal enterprises and heists
Supports restoration of guild influence across Skyrim

dialogue_samples.greeting: Ah, there you are, lad. Come to hear about the old days, or are you here for business?
dialogue_samples.job_offer: I've got some work that needs doing in the cities. Nothing too fancy, just helping the guild get its foot back in the door, you know?
dialogue_samples.fence: Whatever you've got, I can move it. That's what I do. The guild's been doing this for centuries, and I know every fence from here to Solitude.
dialogue_samples.nostalgic: You should've seen the guild back in the day. We had the jarls eating out of our hands, and the coin flowed like mead at a Nord wedding.
dialogue_samples.supportive: You're doing good work, really bringing the guild back. Makes an old man like me proud to see it.
